ygData.subject: Re: Thanks for the laughs
ygData.msgSnippet: Much like the high level cleric earlier today, I have mothballed my 23rd level monk.  He s boring.  The only thing that I miss about him is that he was just
ygData.messageBody:
Much like the high level cleric earlier today, I have mothballed my 23rd level
monk. He's boring. The only thing that I miss about him is that he was just
starting to go into some interesting places. But the bard will be there soon
enough...

I started a bard because in getting my monk to 23rd I realized that I always
enjoyed grouping with bards. Watching my monk's HPs rise 8 a tick after a
battle was very nice... I thought that they were an interesting class that
provided very useful buffs.

I was wrong of course. They're insanely cool! I'm having the best time in EQ
that I've ever had with my monk or my 13th level Enchanter.

Jason A. Farqu´┐¢
CDI at http://www.pigging.com/



----- Original Message -----
From: Rokenn Swiftsong <rokenn@...>
To: <EQBards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, August 23, 1999 12:50 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Thanks for the laughs


> From: "Rokenn Swiftsong" <rokenn@...>
>
> I want to thank all the people posting the great stories today, I really
> needed a good laugh. I have no great story myself to add (as I was running
> all over Tunaria last night looking for medium quality animal skins to
> practice tailoring on). But I did hear a funny joke in West Karana:
> A guy kills a named Barbarian in WK and shouts out "What is a barbarian head
> good for?"
> Someone answers, "Nothing, they do not even use them."
>
> Keep up the great stories everyone!
>
> Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
> Master Brewer of Societus Argenti
> Amerginn - Test server
>
